required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Benefits of Hearing Aid Microphone Directionality Technologies
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Benefits of Hearing Aid Microphone Directionality Technologies on Spatial Awareness and Speech Intelligibility

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the impact of hearing aid microphone directionality settings on speech understanding in noise for experienced hearing aid users. It will also evaluate the participant's spatial awareness of sounds using different hearing aid microphone directionality settings.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A single group of participants will be evaluating two different microphone settings on commercially available hearing aids
study_design_info.masking_description: During objective testing, participants will not know which microphone setting is being tested.

secondary_outcome.description: objective measure of speech reception thresholds with variable microphone settings

secondary_outcome.time_frame: once per week up to 4 weeks, through end of study
secondary_outcome.description: subjective observations using microphone settings in real world environments

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after initial appointment (Day 14 of study)
secondary_outcome.description: subjective ratings of comfort listening to scenes using variable microphone settings

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks after initial appointment (day 14 of study)
secondary_outcome.description: subjective ratings of sound quality while listening to scenes using variable microphone settings

intervention.description: Commercially available hearing aid with different microphone directionality settings

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must be experienced hearing aid users with moderate to moderate-severe sensorineural symmetrical hearing loss defined as a difference of ≤ 10 dB between ears. Air bone gaps ≤ 10 dB. Must be able to use app and smart phone.
Exclusion Criteria:
-
